title: Alexander Petrie (rugby union)
text:
Alexander Petrie (14 February 1853 – 4 February 1909) was a <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who represented <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> from 1873 to 1880.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
He played as a forward for <a href="Royal%20HSFP">Royal HSFP</a>.
Provincial career.
He represented <a href="Edinburgh%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Edinburgh District</a> against <a href="Glasgow%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Glasgow District</a> in the world's first provincial match, the 'inter-city', on 23 November 1872.
He also represented Edinburgh District against Glasgow District in the 5 December 1874 match.
International career.
His international debut was the home match on 3 March 1873 at Glasgow. He turned out for Scotland a total of 11 times, his last match on 28 February 1880.
Referee career.
After playing, Petrie took up refereeing <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> matches. He refereed an international in <a href="1881%E2%80%9382%20Home%20Nations%20rugby%20union%20matches%23Scotland_vs._Ireland">1882</a>. He also became President of the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Union">Scottish Rugby Union</a>.
Outside of rugby.
Petrie was noted in other sports:- weightlifting, rowing and the hammer throw.
